intro: Arabidopsis petraea, commonly known as the rock cress, is a small flowering plant native to rocky and arid environments in Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually basal, arranged in a rosette, and are covered in fine hairs that help reduce water loss. Arabidopsis petraea is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a hardy species often found in crevices and on slopes.
